name: Carryover basis of capital gains on gifts
objective: Under the baseline tax system, unrealized capital gains would be taxed when assets are transferred by gift. In contrast, when a gift of appreciated asset is made under current law, the donor’s basis in the transferred property (the cost that was incurred when the transferred property was first acquired) carries over to the donee. The carryover of the donor’s basis allows a continued deferral of unrealized capital gains.
